page.title: 07LUTON REMEMBERED
page.content: On July 5th I intervieved an elderly lady, this is what she told me. The differences in a house of the old times to a new one is gas lighting,cooking by range, no front doors,wooden toilets with a bucket emptied every Friday by horse & container. She had lived in Moat Lane all her life. The people in the area were friendly and helpful. She could show us a sewing machine 137 years old. The area has changed a great deal, the Moat House used to be a field as did much of the land around here. She remembers a V.E. day celebration in one of the fields. The changes that she has made to the house include a new roof, new windows, new front & back doors and all new gas pipes.
